definition[0]: to turn a switch on a machine such as an oven, radio etc so that it produces more heat, sound etc
definition[1]: to be found, especially by chance, after having been lost or searched for
example[2]: Eventually my watch turned up in a coat pocket.
definition[2]: to arrive at a place, especially in a way that is unexpected
example[3]: You can’t just turn up and expect a meal.
example[4]: Steve turned up late, as usual.
definition[3]: if an opportunity or situation turns up, it happens, especially when you are not expecting it
example[5]: Don’t worry, I’m sure a job will turn up soon.
definition[4]: to find something by searching for it thoroughly
example[6]: The police investigation hasn’t turned up any new evidence.
definition[5]: to shorten a skirt, trousers etc by folding up the bottom and sewing it
definition[6]: the bottom of a trouser leg that is folded up for decoration or to make it shorter
